moves.2. Nf3 Nc6: The sicillian defense. THis could turn into the accelerated draaagon.
moves.4... d6 5. dxc5 dxc5 6. Bb5 Nf6 7. Qxd8+: I probably have a more comfortable position here.
moves.8. Bg5 Be7 9. O-O-O+ Bd7: The pin on the king and bishop is deadly. So i add another attack. but..
moves.10. Ne5 Nxe5: I hadn't calculated properly. He's now just a piece up.
moves.11. f4: I continue to play aggressively because i'm already a piece down.
moves.13. Bxc6: I don't want him to gain space if I retreat my bishop so i damage his pawn structure.
moves.13... bxc6 14. Bxf6 Bxf6 15. Rhd1 Ra7: I probably could've won the piece back if his pawn was still on the 7th rank.
moves.16. e5: continuing to play as aggressive as possible.
moves.18... f5 19. Nd6+: Could've played En passant but that would damage my stronger pawn structure. d6 is a nice outpost for my knight
moves.19... Bxd6 20. exd6: Taking with the pawn negates alot of moves.
moves.23... g5 24. fxg5 hxg5 25. Ra5 Rh4 26. R: And drops another pawn. Now i have 2 pawns vs a bad bishop
moves.27. b3 g4 28. hxg4 Rxg4 29. Rh1 Rxg2: I think that this was a blunder. Taking my pawn allowed me to play Rh8+
moves.32. Kb2 Ka7 33. Rhxc8 f4 34. Rc8c7: Desperately tries to queen his pawn.
